About this role
Come take a seat as a Sales Consultant at Freedom & enjoy uncapped earning potential!
Why You'll Be Excited About This Role
At Freedom our mission is to make beautiful things for the home available to everyone. As a Sales Consultant, you'll be at the heart of this mission, helping customers find the perfect pieces to make their houses feel like home.
You'll be the expert guide, helping customers navigate our stunning range of products. This role isn't just about selling; it's about building relationships, understanding needs, and being instrumental in helping others create their home. You'll be the friendly face and trusted advisor that customers return to time and again.
How This Will Transform Your Career
Joining Freedom as a Sales Consultant is your gateway to a dynamic and rewarding career in retail and home furnishings. We believe in nurturing talent and providing clear pathways for growth:
Develop expert product knowledge through our comprehensive training programs, becoming a true authority in home furnishings and decor.
Sharpen your sales skills with our ongoing coaching, mastering the art of consultative selling and customer relationship management.
Chart your own course to success with endless opportunities for career advancement. Whether you aspire to lead a team or specialise in a particular product area, we'll support your ambitions.
Why You'll Like Working Here
At Freedom, we're proud to be certified as a Great Place to Work. We're constantly innovating to enhance the work experience for our people. Here's what you can look forward to:
Unlock your earning potential with our uncapped sales incentive scheme – the more you excel, the more you earn.
Join a culture of innovation where your voice and ideas are valued and where you can make a real impact.
Enjoy the perks of flexible working rosters that help you balance your work and personal life.
Feel appreciated with our additional recognition programs, including our National Excellence Awards.
Surround yourself with beautiful things every day and take advantage of a generous 25% staff discount.
Be part of a company with a rich 40-year history that continues to evolve and lead the industry.
What You'll Be Working On
As a Freedom Sales Consultant, you'll be the face of our brand. Your day-to-day will involve:
Engaging customers in meaningful conversations to understand their needs and style preferences.
Providing expert advice on our product range, from sofas to dining sets, bedroom furniture to home accessories.
Identifying opportunities to add value through upselling and cross-selling, always with the customer's best interests at heart.
Create connections and cultivate relationships building a portfolio of repeat customers who trust your expertise.
Contributing to store-wide goals while pursuing your individual targets with enthusiasm and determination.
What Type of Person Will Succeed
We're looking for driven, results-oriented individuals who are passionate about exceeding sales targets while delivering exceptional customer experiences. While previous sales experience is valuable, we prioritise your hunger for success and potential above all.
The ideal Freedom Sales Consultant will have:
A proven track record or natural aptitude for converting conversations into sales, with a focus on achieving and exceeding targets
A customer-focused mindset that puts client satisfaction at the heart of every interaction
Sharp commercial acumen and the ability to identify upselling opportunities while maintaining authentic customer relationships
A competitive spirit and resilience to thrive in a performance-based environment where results directly impact earnings
A natural flair for communication and the ability to build instant rapport with a diverse range of customers.
The ability to work collaboratively in a team while also taking initiative independently.
Passion for continuous improvement, actively seeking feedback and training to enhance sales performance
How to Apply
We're excited to grow our team and would love to learn more about you. To apply for this opportunity, please click apply and send us:
A copy of your resume highlighting your relevant experiences and skills.
Freedom to grow. Freedom to think. Freedom to be.

OPPORTUNITY TO ENHANCE YOUR CAREER - It’s about exceeding your potential.
Based in Sydney and reporting to the Administration Operations Manager (based in Brisbane), this is an opportunity to join the Executive Search team as a float Project Administrator. The Project Administrator will support the wider Executive Search team with various administrative tasks, provide full cover for the Project Coordinators while on annual leave and may assist with Project Coordinator workload overflow from time to time.
The position will be required to be in the office five days a week (6 hours per day). Start and finish times are flexible for the right candidate.
Key Responsibilities:
Provide Annual Leave cover for Project Coordinators
Provide administrative support to the Practice, including diary management, travel, expenses, and correspondence. Exercise discretion in the Partner’s absence, referring urgent matters to the appropriate team members.
Manage the Partner’s schedule and priorities to support business and assignment objectives.
Draft and format Practice documents, including Longlist & Shortlist Reports, Candidate Reports, and Reference Reports, paying particular attention to consistency of formatting, grammar and spelling.
Schedule, organise and log candidate (KF/C and C/C) interviews in Searcher & Outlook.
Deliver professional and timely customer service via phone, email, and in person.
Monitor Accounts receivable aging debtors and follow up with client as appropriate.
Stay informed of all assignment activities and act as a liaison to keep stakeholders updated.
Meet and greet clients and candidates, ensuring a professional and welcoming experience. Use Eptura Engage for all meeting room bookings.
Provide a prompt, accurate handover of active searches and tasks to the Practice EA upon their return.
Concur Credit Card expense claim forms
Prepare and submit Sydney Partners expense claim forms accurately in Concur. Project Coordinator to provide receipts with description of expenditure and appropriate coding. Follow up with Singapore Finance Team to resolve any discrepancies or returned claim forms.
Candidate & Partner Travel Arrangements
Arrange travel and accommodation through Corporate Traveller for all fee earning Partners and Principals. Coordinate travel logistics for candidates including flights and accommodation ensuring accurately coded to the correct search as ‘Billable’. Manage any last minute changes and ensure candidate and Project Coordinator informed.
HireRight Due Diligence checks
Initiate and monitor due diligence background checks through HireRight to support placement of preferred candidates. Project Coordinator will provide the required due diligence checks and candidate details. Provide final DD report to Project Coordinator for distribution to client and file in the O-drive and Searcher Express. Process HireRight invoices through APWF (Accounts Payable WorkFlow) and assist with any Accounts Payable queries.
Setting Up New Engagements in PSA & Salesforce
Create new client opportunities in Salesforce ensuring accuracy and attention to detail. Correct Partner / Principal to be tagged as Opportunity Owner. Confirm position title, client contact details, retainer, and other project details with Partner / Project Coordinator.
If requested, close opportunity as ‘Won’ and create the new search in PSA. Liaise with the OTC Team (Order to Cash Team) and PSA Super User to resolve any contractual terms interpretation.
Event Support & Internal Communications
Support the Senior Client Partners and Communications Director with the planning of Executive Search and Board Services in-house events. Assist with the coordination of logistics, invitations, and materials to ensure a professional outcome. Assist with post-event activities, including follow-up and feedback collection.
Reception Cover
Provide lunch break cover and annual leave cover for Receptionist.
Provide professional front-of-house support by greeting visitors and managing phone and email inquiries. Ensure the reception area is welcoming, efficient, and reflects company standards.
Meeting Room & Technology Support
Provide backup support for MS Teams meeting room setup. Troubleshoot minor technical issues to prevent disruption during meetings. Work closely with IT to escalate and resolve complex technical problems promptly.
Professional Experience/Qualifications:
Five plus years of relevant experience of supporting leaders and senior professionals within a fast-paced, client-focused Professional Services environment.
Skilled in diary management and scheduling logistics for KF/candidate and Client/Candidate interviews.
Experience in scheduling complex travel arrangements for multiple parties both domestically and internationally. \Technically savvy with the ability to learn new systems quickly including PSA, Salesforce, and HireRight.
Advanced PowerPoint skills with high proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Word, and Excel).
Assertive communicator with a proven ability to liaise effectively across teams, manage competing priorities, and maintain confidentiality.
Recognised for professionalism, attention to detail, and delivering high-quality outputs under tight and often competing deadlines.
Experience in event coordination, managing the internal communications, and liaising with attendees and stakeholders.

Alzheimer’s Queensland (AQ) is seeking a detail oriented and experienced Accounts Payable/Receivable Officer to join our experienced finance team on a
6 month fixed term contract.
In this role, you will be responsible for the full spectrum of accounts payable and receivable functions, including reconciliations, reporting, and stakeholder liaison.
About Alzheimer’s Queensland (AQ)
Our operations encompass residential aged care facilities, multi-service respite centres, a resource and advisory centre, a CDC home care program, and a registered training organisation.
Key Responsibilities:
In this role, you will be responsible for delivering accurate and timely financial processing across the accounts payable and receivable functions. Your duties will include:
Processing high volumes of accounts payable invoices, ensuring correct authorisations and accurate cost coding.
Performing supplier statement reconciliations and resolving discrepancies.
Preparing and executing regular accounts payable payment runs.
Managing accounts receivable billing, invoicing, and receipting.
Monitoring and following up on outstanding debtor accounts.
Assisting with front desk reception duties and responding to incoming telephone enquiries, as required.
Preparing monthly journals and balance sheet reconciliations.
Maintaining and updating client spreadsheets for the CDC Home Care Program.
Lodging monthly claims with the Department of Human Services (DHS) in accordance with funding requirements.
Skills, Experience, and Attributes:
To be successful in this role, you will bring:
A minimum of 2 years’ experience in a similar Accounts Payable/Receivable position, ideally within a high volume transactional environment with an gaged care company.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, particularly Excel, Word, and Outlook, at an intermediate to advanced level.
Experience with Accounts Payable/Receivable systems; prior knowledge of Attache software is highly desirable.
The ability to efficiently navigate and work across multiple databases and systems.
Exceptional attention to detail, with a strong focus on accuracy and meeting deadlines.
A proactive and flexible approach, with the capability to work both autonomously and collaboratively within a team.
Benefits and Conditions:
6 - month fixed-term contract – Full Time (76 hours per fortnight)
Located at our head office in Upper Mount Gravatt
On site gym with access to a clinical exercise physiologist
Competitive remuneration package, including access to salary packaging benefits (NFP sector).
Stable supportive team
Opportunities for ongoing professional development and training

job_title: Part Time Customer Service and Sales Assistant
job_description:
Utilise your sales skills and passion for interior design to light up our customers' lives!
Permanent part time customer service and sales role available at our Warners Bay store
Comprehensive and ongoing training - no lighting experience needed!
Job security, performance based profit share incentives, generous team member discounts and Birthday leave!
BENEFITS
To reward you for your efforts, we offer a competitive rate of pay (including higher rates on weekends and public holidays), performance based profit share incentives, paid birthday leave and well being days, generous team member discounts, on-site parking, uniform and laundry allowance, and the opportunity to purchase shares through the Beacon Lighting share scheme.
Not your average retailer, we have strong cultural values which are at the heart of who we are and what we do, and our rosters will offer you a great work-life balance with every second weekend off.
To set you up for success, we will invest in providing you with extensive training, including on-the-job and online learning modules.  We will invite you to attend seasonal catalogue launches to give you a sneak peak of upcoming trends and products, and we offer genuine opportunities for career development and progression.
THE ROLE
Based at our Warners Bay store and averaging approximately 42 hours per fortnight including every second weekend (Saturday and Sunday), the key responsibilities of this part time role include:
Provide expert professional customer service to our retail and trade customers
Promote and expand our Trade Loyalty Program and Trade accounts
Develop strong product knowledge to assist customers in making the best product choice
Achieve and exceed personal sales targets
Support other team members to ensure business goals are met
Contribute to the overall presentation of the store through merchandising and general housekeeping
Support your local community and charitable organisations
ABOUT YOU
To be successful in this role, you will possess the following qualities:
Previous experience in a retail environment
Strong communication skills with the ability to genuinely connect with your customers
An energetic and enthusiastic approach to all aspects of your job
Competency in POS systems and Microsoft Office
The ability to multi-task and prioritise your work effectively
A strong attention to detail
ABOUT BEACON LIGHTING
Lighting is crucial to the way we live, work and feel, which is why we’re passionate about providing our retail and trade customers with expert advice so that they can live brighter by making the best lighting choices. As a household name, we continue to grow year on year and expand into new markets and products. Trading for over 50 years, we owe our success to working together with an energetic approach, enthusiasm, care for others, and by acting responsibly and ethically.
With a passion for people, we value our teams and treat everyone as part of the Beacon family!
HOW TO APPLY
Click on 'Apply Now' and follow the process to complete your application.
Please Note
A criminal history check may be conducted as part of the application process for roles at Beacon Lighting Group.

Founded in Hong Kong in 2016 by the French couple Delphine Lefay and Diego Dultzin Lacoste, OnTheList isa leading premium flash sales concept in Asia and the Middle-East. OnTheList works to minimize the problem of excess stock by turning past-season inventory into sustainable opportunities. OnTheList works directly with retail brands and official distributors, turning old inventory into opportunity by providing a sustainable way for brands to sell past-season items that would have otherwise ended up in landfills, while providing the best deals and steep discounts to our OnTheList members. Since launching in Hong Kong in 2016, OnTheList has hosted over 5,200 flash sales and has built a community of over 1.3 million members across all regions. We’ve since expanded to Singapore, Australia, Malaysia, Korea, Shanghai, Beijing, Thailand, and Dubai.
Sustainability is rooted in who we are and motivates us to continue our mission. To date, we have saved over 8.2 million items from ending up in landfills. Forming OnTheLove, our CSR initiative, has allowed us to deepen our commitment to minimizing our carbon footprint while working with local organizations and hosting regular charity sales.
At OnTheList, our values guide everything we do: Family Spirit is driven by humility, fostering genuine connections with our community. Panache reflects our passion for delivering exceptional experiences, while sustainability is rooted in our commitment to creating a positive impact on the world around us. Excellence is driven by the cooperation of our teams.
WHAT WE WILL TRUST YOU WITH...
Omnichannel Operations Executive plays a critical role in the flawless execution of both offline pop-up events and selected online sales. This is a hands-on operational role where precision, reliability, and accountability are essential.
You will progressively take ownership of larger and more complex events as your confidence and expertise grow.
Key Responsibilities
Offline Event Operations (Pop-up Sales):
Pre-Event Preparation:
Prepare and upload stock lists and quota rules into Shopify and internal systems with meticulous accuracy.
Coordinate with brand and logistics partners to ensure timely delivery of stock and furniture to event venues.
Ensure all systems and processes are fully prepared ahead of event.
During Event:
Receive and verify all incoming stock, ensuring 100% accuracy against delivery documentation.
Own the inbound inventory process for assigned events, from scanning to system entry.
Prepare and communicate inbound report to brand partners with professionalism and clarity.
Actively support the physical setup of the event, progressively taking ownership of setup responsibilities.
Support testing of Shopify POS systems before going live.
Provide backend support during sales, including inventory and promotion updates.
Assist the sales team as needed to ensure smooth customer experience.
Assist in preparing and sharing daily sales reports with brand partners.
Post-Event:
Own the repacking and outbound inventory process ensuring zero discrepancies.
Organize bump-out logistics, ensuring all stock is properly accounted for.
Liaise with brand partners to communicate outbound reports and resolve any adjustments needed.
Online Event Operations (Warehouse Supervision):
Travel to warehouses in Western Sydney and occasionally Melbourne to supervise some key online events.
Oversee and support the inbound process at 3PL warehouses, ensuring accuracy and raising any issues immediately.
Monitor pick and pack processes to ensure compliance with brand requirements and internal standards.
Act as the key liaison between warehouse teams and the e-commerce team to maintain alignment.
Support warehouse teams with queries and operational guidance.
Identify and propose process improvements to enhance efficiency and accuracy.
Maintain exceptional accuracy across all stock movements.
Build and maintain strong relationships with 3PL partners, ensuring reliable service delivery.
WHAT IT TAKES…
At least 2-3 years of experience in operations, logistics, supply chain or inventory management.
Strong background in stock control and inventory accuracy, you understand the importance of every single unit.
Experience working in fast-paced, high-volume environments (retail, e-commerce, or FMCG).
Proven ability to work under pressure and deliver flawless results during peak periods.
Advanced Excel skills is essential.
Comfortable using scanner systems and inventory management software.
Knowledge of Shopify and Shopify POS systems is a plus.
Experience working with 3PL warehouse partners is a plus.
Luxury goods and/or cosmetic handling experience is a plus.
Physical Requirements:
Ability to meet the physical demands of the role, including standing for extended periods, moving stock, and working in warehouse environments (in accordance with Australian workplace health and safety requirements).
Availability to work long days and occasional weekends during major events.
Who You Are:
Extreme Attention to Detail:
You catch every discrepancy and take pride in perfect accuracy.
Reliable & Trustworthy:
You can be counted on to deliver, every single time.
High Stamina & Pressure Resilience:
You thrive during intense event periods and maintain focus under pressure.
Proactive & Solution-Oriented:
You identify issues before they become problems and propose improvements.
Strong Communicator:
Comfortable liaising with various stakeholders including warehouse teams, logistics partners, and luxury brand representatives.
What We Offer
Growth Opportunities:
Opportunity to progress into operations management roles as the business grows and the team expands.
Diverse Experience:
Gain exposure to both offline events and online e-commerce operations, working with luxury brands.
Trust & Autonomy:
Build your expertise and become the go-to operations expert the team relies on.
Sydney-Based:
Work primarily from Sydney CBD with occasional travel to warehouse locations in Sydney or Melbourne.
